div.p: S. Although you will learn everything abundantly from the most illustrious Prince Christoph and his companions about the new events being reported, I did not want to let them leave without my letter to you and wanted to add this: Yesterday, I learned from our consul that things in France are very disturbed and are leading to a new tumult, which is about to arise soon. This seems to be confirmed by the fact that some Swiss captains have gathered in Solothurn. The devil cannot remain calm; may God step on his neck. You will learn more from them.
To the most distinguished man, Lord Heinrich Bullinger, the most faithful pastor of the church in Zurich, my honorable lord and dearest compatriot.
